column1: Shuangcheng District (simplified Chinese: 双城区; traditional Chinese: 雙城區; pinyin: Shuāngchéng Qū) is one of nine districts of the prefecture-level city of Harbin
column4: covering part of the southwestern suburbs. The district was approved to establish from the former Shuangcheng City (双城市) by the Chinese State Council on May 2
column5: 2014. It sits approximately 42 kilometres (26 mi) south-southwest of downtown Harbin. Formerly a county-level city until 15 May 2014. The westernmost county-level division of Harbin City
column6: it borders Daoli District to the north
column7: Nangang and Pingfang Districts to the northeast
column10: as well as the Jilin prefecture-level divisions of Changchun to the south and Songyuan to the southwest.
